speaker: Last Toast
lines: The stein is heavier than it looks, lighter than it should be.
Frost rims the lip; heat hums in the handle.
When you lift it, the room standsâ€”a courtesy offered to old kings and good jokes.
You drink. It is every first drink that ever made sense and every last drink that ever told the truth.
The cat meows in a key you have been tuning toward all evening.
The barkeep bows from wherever he is and the walls clink their glasses.
You understand why the Broken Mug has never actually broken.
You leave it as you found it, and leave different than it found you.

give_item.name: Last Toast
give_item.description: Raise and renew: a benediction that steadies the hand
